name: oleo
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of margarine (= food used for cooking and spreading on bread, made with vegetable oil): A lot of older recipes call for Oleo - young folks don't know it's margarine. Sauté the celery and onion in oleo. He claimed that you couldn't tell oleomargarine from butter.
More examplesFewer examplesNothing had been touched since 1947 - there were empty cans of oleomargarine and newspapers with headlines about the war. The law prohibited the serving of colored oleomargarine in restaurants as a substitute for butter unless the customer specifically asked for it.
